definition: scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
school/sect/purpose/model/ancestor/clan/to take as one's model (in academic or artistic work)/classifier for batches, items, cases (medical or legal), reservoirs

sentences.english: The police report described, in horrifying detail, the nightmare that followed.
sentences.chinese: 警方卷宗描述了接下來發生的噩夢，令人戰慄的細節。

sentences.english: It closes all folder viewing windows.
But the memory was like a retrieved file.
sentences.chinese: 但記憶像被收回去的卷宗。

sentences.english: Chang pointed to a row of file cabinets file dossier said.
sentences.chinese: 張毅指着文件櫃裏的一排檔案卷宗說。

sentences.english: The correspondence was all put away in numbered files.
sentences.chinese: 存放在編了號的卷宗內。

sentences.english: Some of the quotations mentioning the lost books provide clues to their content.
sentences.chinese: 有些關於迷失卷宗的引語提供了內容線索。

sentences.english: The file's got all the details of the new desk range.
sentences.chinese: 這封卷宗涉及到新辦公桌系列的所有細節情況。

sentences.english: This is just one more piece in building a case file.
sentences.chinese: 這只是建立卷宗的冰山一角而已。

sentences.english: I'm looking ather murder book now.
sentences.chinese: 我正在看這個案子的卷宗。

definition: memorial to the emperor (folded in accordion form)
to put down in writing/to take down notes/transcript/record
to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
to read through to evaluate/to referee
